alert.note: Alert for Rockingham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:48AM EST until January 10 at 3:53PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia...North Carolina... New River At Allisonia affecting Wythe and Pulaski Counties. Roanoke (Staunton) River At Brookneal affecting Charlotte, Halifax and Campbell Counties. Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph affecting Charlotte and Halifax Counties. Dan River at South Boston affecting Halifax County. Dan River near Danville affecting Pittsylvania, Rockingham, Caswell and the City of Danville. Dan River at Paces affecting Halifax County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia...North Carolina... Pigg River Near Sandy Level affecting Pittsylvania County. Dan River Near Wentworth affecting Rockingham County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River At Altavista affecting Pittsylvania and Campbell Counties. For the Roanoke River...including Brookneal...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Roanoke River...including the Pigg River near Sandy Level, and Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Dan River...including Wentworth, Danville, Paces, and South Boston...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Dan River near Wentworth. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.5 feet, Dan Valley Road and River Road in Madison are closed by floodwaters. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 19.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM EST Wednesday was 21.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 2.7 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.6 feet on 02/23/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1100 AM EST.
